author: Yantoultra Ngui
title: Malaysia’s Mahathir Leads Opposition to Election Win
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia—The opposition led by former leader Mahathir Mohamad won a majority in parliamentary elections, the official Election Commission said, dealing a major blow to a political machine that has dominated politics since independence in 1957.
Dr. Mahathir, 92 years old, has vowed to reopen an investigation into Prime Minister Najib Razak, 64, in what he said was Mr. Najib’s theft of hundreds of millions of dollars from state investment fund 1MDB. Mr. Najib and 1MDB deny any wrongdoing, and Mr. Najib was cleared...
